steps.title: The Cloudify Console dashboard
steps.content:
This tour reviews the areas of the Cloudify Console dashboard.
Let's get started...

steps.title: Console pages
steps.content:
Here you can click on a page to work with a specific group of Cloudify actions, such as Local Blueprints or Deployments.
Administrators can customize the pages to help streamline your work.

steps.title: Widgets on the pages
steps.content:
On each page is a set of widgets. Each widget lets you do a specific Cloudify action. Widgets are grouped on the page so that you can easily access related actions.
Administrators can also customize the widgets on each page to meet your needs.

steps.title: Manager Services Status
steps.content: Here you can quickly review the status of the Cloudify services to see if there is anything that needs attention.

steps.title: Switch to other tenants
steps.content: If you have multiple tenants on the Cloudify Manager, here you can select the tenant that you want to work on.

steps.title: Get help
steps.content: If you need more information about using the Console or the Cloudify Manager, here you can find links to documentation, video tutorials, and knowledge base articles.

steps.title: User Configuration and Logout
steps.content:
The user menu here gives adminstrators access to customizing pages and page templates for different user roles.
It is also where you logout.

steps.title: Let’s deploy some blueprints!
steps.content: Here we go. Grab yourself a blueprint from the catalog, upload it to the local collection of blueprints (Upload? Whatever..), and deploy the blueprint to a… wait for it… DEPLOYMENT!

steps.title: Catalog of blueprints in the sky
steps.content: This is the catalog of blueprints. It’s a list of blueprints stored in the cloud that you can use in your manager. Don’t be confused. These blueprints aren’t actually on the manager until you click Upload. So obvious, right?

steps.title: Upload the blueprint to the manager
steps.content: When you click this button, a galactic star command fleet is ordered to capture the blueprint from the evil Cloud Master and return it to its rightful place in the manager storage. And if you believe that...

steps.title: List of local blueprints
steps.content: The list of blueprints shows the name and icon of each blueprint, its visibility level, creation date, update date, creator, name of main blueprint .yaml file and the number of deployments created from it.

steps.title: Where are my deployments?
steps.content: When you click on Deploy, you need to enter the input values for the deployment, or else you are mocked by the crowd that’s watching on reality TV. Are you ready?

steps.title: Here are your deployments
steps.content:
There you have it -- Deployments! Are you happy now? Isn’t that what you wanted this whole time?
Those are the basics of deploying. Anything more complicated than that is extra charge. Payment is accepted in dollars, sterling, bitcoin, or any other current or future currency.
Have fun!
